projectPurpose: To educate individuals on the fundamental concepts and practical implementation of writing an operating system kernel for embedded systems using the Rust programming language, specifically targeting Raspberry Pi boards.
mainFeatures: Step-by-step tutorial for writing an OS kernel from scratch
Covers core OS concepts (memory, exceptions, I/O)
Each tutorial is a bootable kernel binary
Designed for hobbyists and beginners in OS development

alternatives.name: Operating System Concepts (Textbook)
mainFeatures: Covers process management, memory management, storage
Includes examples from real operating systems (Linux, Windows, macOS)

alternatives.name: The Embedded Rust Book
platforms: N/A (Focuses on ARM Cortex-M examples, concepts general)
mainFeatures: Introduction to embedded Rust on bare metal
Setting up embedded Rust development environment
Aims for writing correct embedded software with Rust

alternatives.name: Linux Kernel Development Resources
mainFeatures: Guides for contributing to the Linux kernel

marketPositioning: The rust-raspberrypi-OS-tutorials project is positioned as a practical, hands-on, and hardware-specific tutorial series for learning the fundamentals of embedded operating system development. It uniquely combines the modern Rust programming language with the popular and accessible Raspberry Pi platform, targeting hobbyists and those new to ARMv8-A bare-metal development. Unlike purely theoretical resources or educational OSes using older languages/hardware, it offers a step-by-step guide to building a functional kernel on widely available boards, emphasizing user-friendliness and practical application.
